thread.title: REPORT: Tracy Claeys Fired as Minnesota Football Coach | Gopher Blog | K102
thread.title_full: REPORT: Tracy Claeys Fired as Minnesota Football Coach | Gopher Blog | K102

title: REPORT: Tracy Claeys Fired as Minnesota Football Coach | Gopher Blog | K102
text:
Adam Bettcher / 2016 Getty Images The skeptics were out a little more than a year ago when the interim tag was lifted from Tracy Claeys head coach title. Whether or not it has anything to do with his coaching ability is yet to be seen, but the skeptics were proven right as today the University announced that Tracy Claeys has been relieved of his coaching duties effective immediately. — Mark Rosen (@WCCORosen) January 3, 2017 
Many think that Claeys may have made his own bed when he backed the player’s boycott for suspended players against the University leading up to their bowl game with a tweet that might have made the decision for them. Winning the Holiday Bowl as big underdogs added some doubt to the situation but ultimately, the University opted to go a different direction. 
Multiple reports are pointing towards Western Michigan head coach P.J. Fleck as the new replacement atop the program. The 36-year old coach led the Broncos to a 13-0 record this season before losing their recent bowl game 24-16 to Wisconsin. Still, he remains one of the most attractive options for a team like the Gophers. Contact
